Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the RPD's decision denying refugee status due to lack of credible evidence and adequate state protection was reasonable
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review under subsection 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicants deemed not credible due to inconsistencies in testimony (e.g., number of cars owned, partial payment to FARC)
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Sections 96 and 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Well-founded fear of persecution by FARC in Colombia
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of credible evidence and adequacy of state protection in Colombia
Crimes.Regulation_Cited: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, subsections 96, 97, and 72(1)
Crimes.Application_Error: Inconsistencies in applicant’s narrative affecting credibility
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None identified – RPD considered available evidence
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Well-founded fear of persecution or risk to life upon return
Crimes.Application_Factor: Failure to rebut presumption of state protection
Crimes.Authority: Refugee Protection Division, Federal Court on judicial review
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Reasonableness of RPD's credibility and state protection findings
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credible evidence and sufficient state protection in Colombia
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Process followed standard refugee determination procedures
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Alleged misrepresentation in border documentation or claims process
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Judicial review challenging reasonableness of RPD decision
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Standard of review in administrative law context
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to provide consistent and corroborated evidence
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Not applicable – claim found not credible under refugee criteria

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Refugee status determination based on alleged assault
Crimes.Prior_Criminality: Not applicable – victim of alleged crime
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Found not credible due to implausible details (e.g., partial payment expectation)
Crimes.Risk_Assessment: Perceived personal risk from FARC threats
Crimes.Risk_Nature: Threats leading to fear of harm
Crimes.Targeted_Victimization: Yes – specific demands and interactions with FARC
Crimes.Legal_Framework: International refugee law, domestic immigration law
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Convention refugee definition based on fear of persecution
Crimes.Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities with well-founded fear standard
Crimes.Legal_Procedure: Refugee determination followed by Federal Court review

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Refugee status based on fear of kidnapping
Crimes.Victim_Status: Civilian subjected to threats and extortion
Crimes.Aggravating_Factors: Pattern of targeting individuals for abduction
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Deemed not credible due to implausible behavior (e.g., partial payment)
Crimes.Risk_Assessment: Fear of future harm including abduction
Crimes.Targeted_Victimization: Yes – direct contact and demands from FARC
Crimes.Targeted_Individual_Status: Business owner perceived as financially capable
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Well-founded fear of persecution or danger to life
Crimes.Standard_of_Proof: Well-founded fear standard (less than balance of probabilities)
Crimes.Procedural_Issues: Credibility and burden of proof issues
Crimes.Legal_Procedure: Refugee hearing and subsequent judicial review

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Refugee claim based on extortion by FARC
Crimes.Victim_Status: Private individual subjected to financial demands
Crimes.Aggravating_Factors: Use of threats of violence to extract payments
Crimes.Mitigating_Factors: State capacity to respond to such crimes
Crimes.Criminality_Severity: High – linked to broader pattern of coercion
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Testimony, documentary evidence of general conditions
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Found not credible due to implausible actions (e.g., paying half the demand)
Crimes.Risk_Assessment: Fear of continued threats and potential escalation
Crimes.Risk_Nature: Coercive criminal activity by non-state actors
Crimes.Targeted_Victimization: Yes – repeated demands directed at applicant
Crimes.Procedural_Issues: Burden of proof and credibility assessment
